intro: Angelphytum reitzii, commonly known as the Reitz's angelphytum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, adapting well to arid and semi-arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
